website_summaries.verdict: A grain-free option designed for  healthy cats.
pros: Contains probiotics and antibodies that support a cat's immune health
Fatty acid blend helps improve a cat's skin and coat
cons: Sometimes causes lethargy and fatigue in cats

website_summaries.verdict: While it has a lot of quality ingredients and no grain, it's more expensive than very similar competitors.
pros: Provides a grain-free diet with roasted venison, salmon, fruit, and vegetables
Consumers are thrilled with how much their cats love it
cons: Pricey, and some cats didn't like it
Some owners also reported digestive upset after their cats ate it

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE! Made my cat throw up daily.
customer_reviews.text: My cat went through a throwing up phase and it happened quite often. I didn't even think about it being the dry food since it was "healthy". I happened upon a website that pretty much said this stuff was poison. Out of 120 cat food brands, it was rated number ONE for containing the highest amount of harmful environmental and industrial contaminants and toxins. Sure enough, when we switched his dry food he stopped throwing up. Threw it in the trash, no regrets.
customer_reviews.author: rabekahjoanne

customer_reviews.title: My cats eat better than I do
customer_reviews.text: After running out of subscribe and save Instinct brand Chicken flavor cat food, I bought this for my cats to tide them over until the next shipment came in. I found that they greatly preferred this particular food. When I looked at the ingredients I found that they were eating better than I do. Also, I will say that I don't know how a cat could normally eat deer, but maybe that's what they dream about at night. Taking down a damn whole deer like they're a badass mountain lion or something. Then they wake up and eat this and watch Netflix with me. So fierce. Highly recommend for your fierce little home predator.
customer_reviews.author: smt4242

customer_reviews.title: Something is wrong with this cat food
customer_reviews.text: Something is wrong with the bag I bought. I've bought this flavor before, but this batch - my cat does not like! I have a little left from the last bag I bought, and she will chow that down, but won't touch this one. I've left in in her dish for days on end - nothing. She is not an picky eater. I got a bad batch and would love to exchange it for a good bag!!!!!!! Can' buy taste of the wild again for fear that is won't be edible!
customer_reviews.author: Vongiese

customer_reviews.title: Recent batch is toxic.
customer_reviews.text: My vet recommended this dry chow for my cat who has developed a food allergy. First bag was fine; he loved it. Current bag has made him progressively sicker, and he now refuses to eat it. Each time he has eaten it over past 3 weeks he has immediately vomited, often numerous times. I am now stuck with an expensive 15 lb bag of questionable cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Al R.

customer_reviews.title: I thought that with the good reviews, and natural ingredients it was a great ...
customer_reviews.text: This was the first food we bought for our 5year old cat after adopting her. I thought that with the good reviews, and natural ingredients it was a great choice, however I've read a lot about cats having autoimmune reactions to it. Our cat would lose 1inch patches every few months, and after a year we finally attributed it to the food. We recently switched her to Farmina, and haven't had issues in the few months.
customer_reviews.author: Peter M.

customer_reviews.title: TOWT SHINES
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this since I adopted Bruiser, a long, lean, 18-lb. neutered male, 4 years ago. It's great but I couldn't overcome a secret nagging that Blue Buffalo would be better. Comparing ingredients, I couldn't justify the price differential. Then I got a bag of BB on sale for the same price as TOTW. It was fine, he finished and bag and returned to TOTW. About 10 days later, I noticed that Bruiser's coat had a brilliant shine. Same good overall health. I feel completely fine feeding him TOTW from now on, knowing I'm making the best choice.
customer_reviews.author: merrymole

customer_reviews.title: Healthy Option and 15lb Bag Lasts Forever
customer_reviews.text: My kitty loves this food and I won't be changing it anytime soon. If you love your cat and care about their well-being, don't feed them fattening slop, get them something full of the protein they need! My cat is 3 years old and has pretty much been eating this since she could chew hard foods. She's super spunky and healthy and maintains a good weight and shiny coat. I keep the food in a resealable container because the bag is unwieldy and the food will go stale if not properly contained.
customer_reviews.author: Meliae

customer_reviews.title: Cats go "wild" for this food!
customer_reviews.text: My cat was diagnosed for food allergy to fowl. Bought this particular food because it was suggested by my vet and it was the least expensive of the few she did suggest. Both my cats love it! Unfortunately, because the food allergy cat is still taking prednisone, he's a little fat and so is his brother because I have to make sure they have food aplenty due to increased appetite from the prednisone. When I needed to reorder, this size of product was unavailable so I ordered from Chewys.com which was okay but I had to spend $49 for free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: S. Miller

customer_reviews.title: This is my Cat's vote, not mine.
customer_reviews.text: This is my Cat's vote, not mine. At first they ate but did not exhibit much enthusiasm. Finally they (2 cats) would leave 1/2 the serving empty until next feeding time. A sure vote that they are not crazy about this food. I kept in a tightly sealed container so I don't think it became stale. I've reverted to a Purina brand-X that they finish immediately, then look for more.
customer_reviews.author: Flipper

customer_reviews.title: Our cat enjoys the food just fine, and I like the high protein content and ...
customer_reviews.text: Our cat enjoys the food just fine, and I like the high protein content and grain-free formula. My only complaint - and maybe this is odd - is that my cat seems to have a dirty, gross butt while she's on this food. I'm assuming her waste is a little more loose, as it gets caught in the fur, and when she sits on something after using the litter box it leaves a gross little splooch, like the most horrible lipstick mark in the world. So you can meditate on that for a while. I would buy this food all the time if it weren't for that. I'm looking for something else right now.
customer_reviews.author: KindaPicky

customer_reviews.title: Great Cat Food!!
customer_reviews.text: My siamese cat was constantly scratching himself, vomiting his food, and loosing fur - his fur coat looked terrible and almost bald in places. I decided to try more premium catfoods, but he still puked and scratched. Finally in desperation I switched to this grain free premium food and he just loves it. He don't puke anymore and I can say his fur coat is more fuller and shinier than it's ever been since I've had him - which can all be attributed to switching to this food. I'm trying the grain-free Taste of the Wild Canyon River next to give him some variety.
customer_reviews.author: Floyd D. Crook

customer_reviews.title: I like this product a lot more than Blue B
customer_reviews.text: I keep having to rotate foods because we cannot figure out what is making my cats sick/what ingredient they are allergic to. I like this product a lot more than Blue B. The bags are a bit higher quality. The cats love it, in fact, they love it a lot more than BB. My main issue is that even though it is supposed to be without several ingredients - and I believe it is - my cats still have upset stomachs from it. My only other concern is that the price on Amazon jumps around. If you do this on subscribe, be sure to watch that.
customer_reviews.author: MAG

customer_reviews.title: I went from scooping the litter box 4 times a day to only twice a day very quickly
customer_reviews.text: I went from scooping the litter box 4 times a day to only twice a day very quickly, and the excessively stinky poop now just smells like regular cat poop. I will only have to use half of the amount of litter that I’m using now. Both of my cats transitioned from the major national brand to this brand and only four days. They love it. They also seem to be happier and more content. I am certain that their kitty bellies no longer bother them. I am so happy I purchased this brand.
customer_reviews.author: LLB

customer_reviews.title: Getting over-priced and losing weight.
customer_reviews.text: Sorry, but even though my cats like it, I’m not buying it again. The price has gone up $7 since I last bought it in November. And they have reduced the weight from15 pounds to 14. It’s officially a rip-off.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to try new food for my two cats. This product seems like it has good reviews and my cats are both female so I thought it would be ok. They both started throwing up (projectile vomiting) EVERY DAY after each feeding, one cat started having diarrhea when we started feeding them this. We had to stop giving them this food. After we ordered the one we used to feed (hills science diet sensitive stomach dry food) they immediately stopped vomiting. We threw the whole package out. Waste of money :/
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best pet food out there!
customer_reviews.text: We have tried many brands, and some of them were very good but nothing compared to Taste of the Wild. High quality product, great customer service, and my pets love it. We have 2 cats and 3 dogs, all on TofW. Their coats are healthy and soft, their weight is perfect on this diet and they seem to really like the flavors offered. 5 years on Taste of the Wild and counting!!
customer_reviews.author: B.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: An Oldie and Goodie
customer_reviews.text: After feeding TOTW to my cat for 5 yrs I moved to a location that didn't have any stores nearby that carried it. I went through several other brands from local stores trying to find one that was healthy, the cat liked, and didn't make us go broke. I finally gave up and ordered TOTW off Amazon. Just got my bag and seeing him dig right in made me know I made the right choice! FIY, my cat does not seem to like kibble that is salmon flavored but seems ok with the venison and salmon. I believe the other is just fish and he didn't seem too crazy last time I tried it.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen long

customer_reviews.title: Best food I've fed!
customer_reviews.text: Always a great buy. All stages for pets. My boy Charlie won't eat ANYTHING but totw, he is lean!! The vet said his weight is optimal! I have my kitten Remington on this (he's a half pound over but he's gonna be a big boy, oh and he's a snacker) My oldest Romeo has been on this for years and he used to be overweight and has balanced out for his size. My cats self feed too and as much as I wish my schedule allowed them to not, they do well health and weight wise. Add the canned (small scoop) for breakfast for hydration!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle

customer_reviews.title: Taste of the Wild Rocky Mountain Grain Free
customer_reviews.text: Have been buying this for my Cat for almost a year now and it's the only brand I feed her. Love that it's natural and chemical free. I let her eat all she want's, I keep her bowl filled at all times. It keeps her at the weight she should be without getting fat, it's also made her fur extra silky and she's more full of energy. I buy both different flavors they have and mix them together,so she has 4 flavors to eat at the same time. She loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Lil_Kitten7

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Loves It
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves it. He begs for breakfast. Before this he was on Kirkland brand, but when I switched my dog to TOTW, my cat switched too. He's never been a picky eater, but the transition to this brand was seamless. He can get dandruffy, but I don't know if it's TOTW really helping with that, or the fish oil supplements. Either way, he's a happy cat. He also doesn't seem to have food sensitivities or allergies.
customer_reviews.author: CamilleElise

customer_reviews.title: Mixed reviews from cats
customer_reviews.text: I have two cats: one who is picky and another who would eat cardboard. Neither seemed to enjoy eating this food. They ate much slower than usual and never ran to the bowl to eat, which they used to do. I guess this could mean they were eating less of this food because it was so high in protein. I'm not sure, but I didn't see any change in weight, activity, or anal gland expression (one cat is having issues) so I decided to switch back to Blue Mountain.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nobody really knows
customer_reviews.text: Raw? Freeze-dried? Store bought? Canned? The jury is always out on what food is best for your cat. Personally, my two 10 year old cats been on this food for almost a year. You can definitely tell that there's more fatty acids, because one of them has developed oily fur. Apart from aesthetics, it seems that she is healthier. I'm not really sure why you'd need cranberries, and it seems like there is some debate on the other ingredients.. specifically if they're really needed. There's talk that some ingredients could also be even harmful for them. If anyone could let me know what what we've all decided on, I'd appreciate it.
customer_reviews.author: Nixie Pixel

customer_reviews.title: Poor Packaging or something
customer_reviews.text: I actually like this cat food a lot because all 3 of my cats eat it and they don't gain weight. But I am very disappointed in the latest shipping, I would have totally shipped it back because the bag had a line of small holes in it. I have one cat who is very picky eating and if the food seems "stale" (left in her dish too long) she won't eat it. So an opened bag of food for weeks or more? Not good. I keep their food in vacuum sealed containers. Otherwise I love this actual food for my guys.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi

customer_reviews.title: They don't eat as much as the did with the other crap that I used to buy
customer_reviews.text: I started buying this brand back when I worked at Tractor Supply and I've never looked back. Both of my cats coats are shiny too. They don't eat as much as the did with the other crap that I used to buy. I HIGHLY recommend this product to anyone who is looking for a grain free and high in protein for their cats. My cats Pumpkin (orange) and Ginger! My only wish was that there were more than just the two flavors to choose from for cats.
customer_reviews.author: Mith

customer_reviews.title: Price Point is Great & My Cat Loves It
customer_reviews.text: We used to feed our cat Blue Buffalo. There was nothing wrong with it per say it was just very expensive for how little you got. The price point of Taste of the Wild is much better. My cat also seems to enjoy this brand over Blue Buffalo. He eats much faster and tries biting open the bag to get at the food inside. He never seemed that interested in the Blue Buffalo. We have purchased the salmon flavor and the venison flavor. He eats both no problem. The ingredients are real food and not processed garbage. We will be Taste of the Wild customers for life.
customer_reviews.author: Jenay Rainey

customer_reviews.title: Not sure what happened
customer_reviews.text: My cat usually loves this food. I bought the 15 lb bag this time and she hates it and has been vomiting almost daily. Expiration date is good.
customer_reviews.author: K. Masson

customer_reviews.title: My kitty's fur and skin look great!
customer_reviews.text: My 7-year old female has skin issues with certain types of food (even expensive, quality brands from Petco and PetSmart). She will get dull fur, flakes on her back and start pulling out her hair near the base of her tail/low back. This has been the only food that seems to work to prevent these issues. Her coat is now lustrous and shiny. No flakes!
customer_reviews.author: T. Marshall

customer_reviews.title: Times are Hard
customer_reviews.text: Times are hard so I was looking for a more economical dry food for my cats, reviews were positive for Taste of Wild. The price was cheaper than what i was buying at Petco (Blue Buff Wilderness) and it's 15/16 lbs. My cats took to the food no problem, no change in litter box smell and my cats seem satisfied. I should have bought 3 or 4 bags when they were $27. For the price and amount of food this is a good deal and the ingredients are pretty good also
customer_reviews.author: mumra

customer_reviews.title: I wish it didn't make my cat's poop stink.
customer_reviews.text: My cats and I both love this product. It is an incredible deal and grain free which is important to me. My picky cat went crazy for this food and loved the way it tastes. Unfortunately as soon as I switched them over (slowly by the way) their poop started smelling like hell on earth. Typically their litter boxes never really smelled, and I cleaned them every other day. After eating this new food the entire room would smell for at least an hour, and it was the worst smell imaginable. I wish I could keep purchasing this food because my cats love it and it is an excellent price. Unfortunately my nose just can't take it anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B

customer_reviews.title: All my cats coats are softer.
customer_reviews.text: I live in a house with multiple cats, two are mine and three are my house mates. My biggest kitty has also lost a pound since switching over, went from 10 to 9. All cats are free fed and after only a month of eating this I notice that their coats are feeling softer. The only reason I haven't given 5 stars is because although the bag is advertised as 15 lbs I am no sure if it really is. Other bags of cat food that were 11 lbs lasted the entire month and this last bag I had to order a new bag only halfway through the month.
customer_reviews.author: Star Z.

customer_reviews.title: Diamond brand class action
customer_reviews.text: I bought this cat food after about five hours of researching online didn't realize about Diamond brands lawsuit,thought this food was healthier than it is. The Veniso and Salmon are 7th and 8th ingredients in the dry food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Taste of the wild...
customer_reviews.text: Not the best, but good. The cats like it and it seems to be a good quality brand. Its know to be a better brand of cat/dog food. Its grain free which is definitely plus. Grain is not a good thing to have in your cat/dog food. It should be avoided as much as possible. Keep your pet alive and healthy as long as possible with a healthy source of food. Stay away from the unatural ingredients and chemicals!
customer_reviews.author: RS

customer_reviews.title: Made cat vomit.
customer_reviews.text: My cat really loved this stuff, but began vomiting soon after eating it regularly. Every morning, like clockwork, she would throw up. I stopped the ToW, and the vomiting stopped. Unsure, I tried to reintroduce it, but the day I tried it she threw up again. Expensive...I've given my dog TotW without issue and I've never had problems, but they just don't have the cat formula right. Not for my cat, anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Slerrrrrp

customer_reviews.title: Most recent purchase made cat very sick
customer_reviews.text: We have purchased this food several times with no issue (minus the time the bag came opened and full of ants) but this latest bag has caused our cat to vomit several times a day since we started using it. We switched foods and the issue went away, but are very concerned as to the reaction to this latest batch.
customer_reviews.author: JW

customer_reviews.title: Real ingredients that my cat loves
customer_reviews.text: Great brand, high quality ingredients, high protein, recommended by my vet, and my cat's favorite flavor. She is 12 and this is a big part of my plan to keep her healthy. When i switched to this food a few years ago, I got samples of all the different types of natural food for my cat, laid out small amounts in bowls and monitored which ones she liked best. I then kept whittling down which samples I set out (halving each time, main sure to keep ones she was actually trying) until this one was the clear winner. Ordering online is great because it's a heavy bag and shows up at my door--and it's a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: TOTW is an excellent go grain food.
customer_reviews.text: TOTW is a fine cat food, great ingredients, without grains, and I had NO COMPLAINTS with it. Here's why is switched. I was looking for a food that contained l-lysine for my one cat that has had chronic herpes since birth. I found one that contained a high quantity of it, so I switched brands. But as far as TOTW, it had great taste appeal, they all loved it, and was easily digested. No more regurgitations than usual. I have 5 cats. The one with the chronic skin condition showed no improvement, FYI. Wouldn't have changed, but the doctor recommended the l-lysine. In in addition, will get a lysine supplement as well for the herpes.
customer_reviews.author: adra troutTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: This one was the only one she really liked. (That's coming from a cat who punished me ...
customer_reviews.text: My cat loves this stuff! When I had to switch her to grain free a few years ago, I tested several types. This one was the only one she really liked. (That's coming from a cat who punished me to making a habit of something abominable for changing her food when the previous one was discontinued!). She gives it all paws up.
customer_reviews.author: Pet Parent

customer_reviews.title: My 18-year-old cat is thriving on this food.
customer_reviews.text: The two brands of dry cat food that are higher rated are prohibitively expensive. I read a review that said this food is close to them in quality but some experts believe it may have more carbs than a cat needs. Having said that, my vet is very pleased with the results. Her coat is thick, glossy and luxurious. She's not as frisky as she was, but neither am I so maybe that's a good thing. I tried her on the trout and salmon version of this brand, but she didn't do as well on it. She seemed a little shaky at times and she didn't eat as eagerly.
customer_reviews.author: MJ Hughes

customer_reviews.title: Most Affordable Grain-Free I Could Find
customer_reviews.text: When this bag of cat food came and I brought it inside the house, the aroma immediately drew my cats' attention. All three of them (no I'm not a crazy cat lady) eat this right up. But just as importantly, it is grain free! This was the most affordable grain-free cat food I could find. I went looking for a product of this quality because my outside cat had a mammary lump. Due to the $$$ and the uncertainy of having any success with operating, I did not go forward that way. I changed her food and bought her ES-Clear from NHV.  I have no idea why the lump has disappeared, but I'll continue to buy these two products.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: As Reviewed by Yodi and Shorty
customer_reviews.text: I've been asked to write this review for my human dad, since he has no inclination to actually try this food. However, my sister and I love it it's our main stay diet for over 8 years now and we never turn it down. It's quite tasty, keeps our teeth clean and we are both healthy kitties. Now you know cats if they don't like something they just walk away. Well we never walk away. Now we do get an occasional bit of sliced turkey once in a while, a dolop of yogurt in the morning, but Taste of the Wild Venison is our go to staple. Hope this helps all you unknowing humans out there. Yodi and for Shorty
customer_reviews.author: M. G. Tomko

customer_reviews.title: My cats are grain-free and healthy....
customer_reviews.text: I've been feeding this to my 4 cats for over a year now and they love it. I had just lost my "soul mate" cat to kidney failure, and I started doing a lot of online research to find out what I could do to reduce the risk of my other four developing the same thing. With just a little research I realized I needed to make some food changes. . Taste of the Wild had everything I was looking for in a grain-free dry pet food and at a great price. I hope they never stop making this product. My cats love the Rocky Mountain formula with salmon and venison.
customer_reviews.author: macks2opie

customer_reviews.title: My 2 cats & even my small dog would not ...
customer_reviews.text: My 2 cats & even my small dog would not eat this food. I gave it away to a friend that had feral cats in her yard. Wicket, Cricket & Mazie say "Yuck".
customer_reviews.author: Clare

customer_reviews.title: Great for allergic cats.
customer_reviews.text: If you've got a cat with allergies, this is the stuff to use. It's pricey, but they eat less. 1/2 cup per day, per cat. We have 5 cats, and split it into morning and night feeds. They eat less, there is less mess in the litter box, and our allergy cats do a lot better on it. Don't overfeed! It's meant to be fed as directed. It'll be ok, really. We have 5 cats and went from free range feeding a store brand to doing two small meals of this, and they really didn't care. We have an adult dog and a puppy, and they both eat TotW too.
customer_reviews.author: Truce

customer_reviews.title: Great product. My darling cat Macy had stomach issues ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. My darling cat Macy had stomach issues her whole life, this is because we were ignorantly feeding her Friskey's and crap like that. Even when we switched to "grain-free" Blue Buffalo, she had the same problems; very disappointing. It wasn't until switching to Taste of the Wild that she finally gained weight and started having normal BMs. We also supplement with wet food and digestive enzymes. Taste of the wild grain-free is really a wonderful cat food. It's on the expensive side, with a price increase of $3.00 since January, but it's worth it since Macy is doing so well!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew P. Liberatore

customer_reviews.title: Raised price and $11 shipping added
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food. After chicken meal the following ingredients are peas, sweet potatoes, chicken fat, pea protein and potato protein. It is grain free but it isn't vegetable free and cats typically don't digest veggies very well. I bought this because it's price was right and free shipping under prime. Amazon increased to price to over $30.00 and added shipping of another $11+. This puts the product higher than the better "Wellness" brand so I purchased that instead.
customer_reviews.author: redseadiver

customer_reviews.title: My cats generally enjoy Taste of the Wild - Blue Buffalo. But not THIS particular flavor.
customer_reviews.text: Let me state upfront that my cats (I have 12) love Taste of the Wild - Blue Buffalo products. But not this one. They will leave it until they absolutely have nothing else to eat, and even then they'll just nibble. I don't know if it's just this flavor, or a bad batch. But, I'll pass on this one.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Stier

customer_reviews.title: Grain/Corn Free - Lots of Protein - Affordable!
customer_reviews.text: Have been feeding my cats this Taste of the Wild Dry Cat Food for over a year now. Grain/corn free (cats DO NOT need grains/corn), and is packed with protein. They are very healthy, active, their fur is very soft, and they love eating it. I feed them both a little bit of this early every morning, and then later in the evening I feed them 1.5oz of Sheba canned wet food (also grain/corn free and very affordable). As long as the price doesn't go up, I will always buy this cat food.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat seems to really like it. It's hard to tell really
customer_reviews.text: Cat seems to really like it. It's hard to tell really, I used to give him cheap cat food and pretty sure he would eat whatever. What I can tell, is that before I started buying he was having monstrous liquid poops and throwing up frequently. After starting to use this - it took about a month - but that has stopped. I actually makes the cat box a lot more manageable, and like the other reviewer said, doesn't stink as much. The only thing now is the occasional hairballs. Once I figure that out my cat is going to be super low maintenance.
customer_reviews.author: mariomoose

customer_reviews.title: MY DWARF PANTHER SAID...
customer_reviews.text: NO WAY! I had been giving him Rachael Ray. He loved it. On a whim I tried decided to try something new, so I tried Good Life. He love that even more.Hey - I was on a roll! So, based on the ratings I tried this new product. He looked at me as if to say, "You're kidding, right? So much for a living dangerously!
customer_reviews.author: Sherrythere

customer_reviews.title: We love this product!
customer_reviews.text: My vet was selling me a $60 bag (half this size) of the same thing - Venison, for my 13 year old cat who has developed sensitive digestive tract (was pooping out of the cat bin because his stools were getting so hard, he was associating pain with pooping in the cat box...but was still peeing in it thankfully). Switching to the expensive bag stopped the pooping out of the bin problem. I'm glad I looked on Amazon to find this similar product for SO MUCH LESS! It's essentially the same thing.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy E.

customer_reviews.title: Greatest food for cats, void of fillers and/or grains
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing better than giving your pets good food and ensuring they are eating healthy. I began to research cat foods for my pets when I found out that Purina products put a lot of garbage in their foods. I often wondered why their potty use smelled so bad. It was the food! Giving them this food gives me peace of mind. I add some water and often combine it with a bit of wet food such as Pride rabbit, etc because I realize their water intake is lacking... and they love it and cannot wait to eat it when they're hungry. And note that I have a very picky lady cat.
customer_reviews.author: Kay

customer_reviews.title: Buy Purina Beyond instead.
customer_reviews.text: My cats like this, and this food made their coats thick and fluffy... but they started peeing on the carpet. They’re both neutered, well-littertrained cats, and inappropriate peeing never happened before switching to this brand. I’m afraid they might have crystals like other reviews have said. Will switch back to Purina Beyond Grain Free and put them on some UTI care tomorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Vikki Diamos

customer_reviews.title: Cats are getting fat but look great.
customer_reviews.text: My cats are are looking gorgeous on this food. They are looking very solid, maybe a little over weight. We need to change our habit of having good available all the time for them. Their for is so shiny and much less shedding. One of my cats has allergies to wheat. In fact, she was on science diet and it almost killed her before we figured out what was wrong. The nutrients the cats are getting from this food is very high qualityquality. I decided to switch the dog over too.
customer_reviews.author: Damone

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves It
customer_reviews.text: This food has been great. My cat likes to eat it and he is as healthy as ever. He throws up less and his coat looks great. I think this food has been better for his digestion than our last two brands. Overall, I'm pleased with this food and plan to buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: LovelyStrife

customer_reviews.title: First Rate Cat Food
customer_reviews.text: This is excellent cat food. My cats love it, and show no signs of the health issues that crop up from foods that contain grain-based starches. CATS DON'T EAT CORN OR RICE, ETC. TOTW uses peas and sweet potatoes -- no cheap crappy fillers. BTW, that stuff the veterinarians peddle is LOADED with nasty grains. Skip that junk and give your fur kids this instead.
customer_reviews.author: Clarissa Stuart

customer_reviews.title: This is great cat food
customer_reviews.text: This is great cat food, my cat loves it and since eating it I have noticed his fur is much softer and properly thick. He looks healtier too!
customer_reviews.author: Maggie Bent

customer_reviews.title: Great Food for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: I have been feeding this brand of cat food to my 1 year old cats since I brought them home from the shelter. I work for a vet and can get the Hills prescription for around the same price but I prefer Taste of the Wild over the other brand. Why? Because this is grain free and has no added crap while the latter is full of fillers and things like corn and wheat that can aggravate allergies. Both of my cats have shiny soft coats and are in perfect health. The only negative thing I would say is that their poop stinks because of this food but i scoop every day so its not really an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Gorbutt

customer_reviews.title: The only thing I don't like about this particular brand is that it's not sold ...
customer_reviews.text: This is the only dry food my 9 year old cat tolerates. Over the years I have tried multiple brands but all of them would make my cat sick (vomiting and / or diarrhea) This dry food was my savior. And oh, my cat, she is not even a fancy breed or anything, found her by the dumpster when she was a kitten. But as it appears to be she is a very picky eater. The only thing I don't like about this particular brand is that it's not sold in the grocery stores. And I haven't seen it in any pet stores. I have to order it online all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Mila

customer_reviews.title: My Cat Love This Food!
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be more happier. Have been using Blue Buffalo for awhile until I heard about issues with their food a while back. So I switched over to the "Taste Of The Wild" brand and my little fur baby loves it. He has a nice coat & a lean fit body. Quite pleased with this product!
customer_reviews.author: Ty

customer_reviews.title: My kitty thinks this food is delish!
customer_reviews.text: My kitty thinks this food is delish, at least he eats it as though it is! I'm trying a new diet with him that includes both a wet and dry food, that is also healthier than the Science diet foods I'd been giving him. So far I've had success with this and 'Natural Balance Platefulls Indoor Duck, Chicken' wet food. I had no luck with 'Blue Buffalo' wet food, but that is only because my kitty hated it, licked off the gravy and left the cubed chicken, I was starting to think he would only eat pate, but he eats the chunks and gravy in the Natural Balance Platefulls. Who knows what goes on in the mind of a kitty...right!
customer_reviews.author: Grams

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love it.
customer_reviews.text: All 3 of our mature (11 years old) cats love it. 2 brothers and their sister. Maybe sister loves it a bit too much..........she eats up what the boys leave behind if I'm not quick enough to remove it............she's put on a bit too much weight......chubby girl. We have noticed more consistent stools, and their fur seems much softer and shinier. By far the best food we have ever tried.......and we've tried many.
customer_reviews.author: Lobo Azul

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Value and My Kitty Loves It!
customer_reviews.text: There are many glowing reviews here, and at other cat oriented websites as well, that give this brand of dry cat food very high marks. So, I bought a bag for my cat, and she loves it! Not only that, but this is such a good value per pound, that I will probably not be buying any more dry cat food from my [favorite] local organic grocery store. Overall, I would say that the ingredients seem to be superior with the Taste of the Wild product than any of the other "healthy" brands that I bought used to buy, and, Taste of the Wild is an excellent value too.
customer_reviews.author: D. Berry

customer_reviews.title: Thumbelina Approved
customer_reviews.text: Been looking to switch our cat to a healthier food and this had great reviews. I first fed it to the cat like cat trees (Typically she knows its cat food and runs away) but she liked it and ate all the kibble I gave her and then followed me around hoping I'd give her more. Still mixing with old food for the next week or 2 so it doesn't shock her system.
customer_reviews.author: BP-JP

customer_reviews.title: best food on the market
customer_reviews.text: Switched the cats to this after they began vomiting every time after they ate. They were going thru a 15# bag a week of the "other" name brands. Bought this, and now no more vomiting, more playful, healthy weight, beautiful fur, and way less smelly litter boxes. Will never, ever go back!
customer_reviews.author: jdj1981

customer_reviews.title: grain free, meal based cat food with a bit of real meat futher down the ingredient list, $2 per lb is decent price
customer_reviews.text: grain free, meal based cat food with a bit of real meat futher down the ingredient list, $2 per lb is a decent price. diamond manufactures this brand and has their own brand diamond naturals which is similar for a slightly lower price than this, you will want to compare ingredient lists before deciding though. merrick before grain looks to be a better food than the diamond brands for a little bit more price / lb however so i will be going with it for the time being. my cats like this food but i feed my cats a variety of brands so they are used to eating different tastes and not overly picky.
customer_reviews.author: kristixs

customer_reviews.title: Proper diet for cats
customer_reviews.text: We have 5 cats and have used this food for years. It has exactly what cats are meant to eat and no horrible fillers like some supermarket brands. Our cats live long and healthy, happy lives. It is also suitable for kittens. We foster kittens regularly and they all love it! It's quite calorically dense so adult cats are fine with just a small scoop twice a day (no more or they'll get fat, and maybe less; our cats are huge glorious beasties!)
customer_reviews.author: FitCatLady

customer_reviews.title: So far she seems to like the food
customer_reviews.text: This is not the brand of cat food I normally buy, but decided to give it a try after researching the high quality of ingredients. My cat has some dandruff problems, I'm hoping this food will help her get her sleek coat back. So far she seems to like the food. I am also helpful it will help with litter box smells as many other reviewers have stated. I will have to update review on that after a few weeks. Edit, I do feel this food as improved the litter box odor. This just might be her new food! Her dandruff also seems to be a bit better as well!
customer_reviews.author: EAN717

customer_reviews.title: Happy cat, happy cat mom!
customer_reviews.text: It is better for cats to have wet food because they often don't drink enough, but I have one cat who just doesn't like wet food, treats, cat milk, etc for whatever reason. This however, she really enjoys! She was a little underweight when we started her on Taste of the Wild, and in 2 years she has gained about a pound (now 8 lbs). That is partially due to her turning 12, but I think it's also the fact that she enjoys the dry so much. So far we have had no issues with the toilet, vomiting, etc - just a happy cat who was declared very healthy at her last checkup!
customer_reviews.author: Student

customer_reviews.title: A low protein, grain-free solution for a healthy cat.
customer_reviews.text: We originally bought grain-free, low protein (Taste of the Wild) dry food for our bulldog. When our vet said our cats were over-weight, and the oldest cat needed lower protein for its kidney health, we tried their cat food. (We selected this one because it had the lowest protein of all their flavors.) We have three cats, varying ages, and they have been on this ever since (2+ years now). Without the junk-food grain fillers, their weights have dropped. Best of all, our oldest cat no longer had any old-age/kidney-related issues for over two years.
customer_reviews.author: Todd D. Obrien

customer_reviews.title: Expired?
customer_reviews.text: I have been purchasing this for years from same Amazon link with no problems. My last batch, my cats wouldn't eat it. After 3 days when I realized they were literally starving, I ran to pet supermarket and bought it. The pellets were much smaller from Amazon. I am hoping it was just an old batch as I love the convenience of delivery to my doorstep. (I transfer the food to a large Tupperware type container so I couldn't check expiration date) I'll try one more time when I run out of this batch.
customer_reviews.author: K. Muca

customer_reviews.title: Great for cats with digestive issues.
customer_reviews.text: I was having an issue with my cats vomiting small amounts occasionally and one cat vomiting all of his food after he ate at times. I free feed them so for the most part they snack throughout the day. I switched to this food because my mother said her cat was having digestive issues and this really cleared it up. I switched and have not had any vomiting from either cat since - it's been about 4 months. They love the food too!
customer_reviews.author: Vickie

customer_reviews.title: A require review for cats on daily medication :)
customer_reviews.text: I have 5 cats, varying ages and breeds (Persian, mancoon?, tabby). They don't agree on much except that this food is delicious. They stick their noses up at other grain free brands! One of my cats has server medical issues. Crystals in his urinary tract. His Rx food alone is $80 for a 20lb bag! I stopped buying it after I realized that he has less issues when eating taste of the wild. This cat was on 3 daily medications. Now, I haven't stopped all medication but no need for Prednisone or pain meds! I highly recommend this food!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Ali & Jess

customer_reviews.title: Solved my Cats stomach issues
customer_reviews.text: We recently adopted a previously rescued cat. The cat is around 12 years old, and we were told he had stomach issues, and diarrhea frequently. We were given a bag of very expensive cat food that was said to be the best they had found for him, but he was still having issues. We figured we would try Taste of the Wild for cats, since our dogs do so well on Taste of the Wild. Within four days his stomach issues ceased and he began having firm stools. It has been a year now, and our old cat is still doing great with no issues. And he loves it!
customer_reviews.author: BlurXC

customer_reviews.title: Best cat food on the market
customer_reviews.text: My cat has urinary problems due to not enough water in her diet. I switched her to wet food, but she started having diarrhea after a few months on it. I searched for a natural dry food with nutrition, which would force her to drink more water. This fit the bill and it works. Her coat is shinier, she is healthier and her feces are consistent and solid. I supplement this with natural vitamin and hairball treats.
customer_reviews.author: Kashiwagi

customer_reviews.title: Smelly
customer_reviews.text: The reviews about the cat poop smell is not a joke! After a week on the new food it hit bad! I buy the really expense cat litter and it couldn't even help even after I scooped! I just lit a candle to help hid the smell before guests come over!! Switching back to expensive food. It was worth a shot I guess but as my bf says it's not worth it being cheap if we have to smell that disgusting smell all the time!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Our cats love the taste
customer_reviews.text: I researched cat foods for a long time before deciding on this one. Our 10 yr. old male cat love the taste of this cat food and his coat and weight look perfect. Our 6 year old female cat is usually somewhat finicky about food and she took to this food right away. We had to switch from another brand because our female kitty ended up with kidney problems from the other one.
customer_reviews.author: Makiki90

customer_reviews.title: My cats love this food and it is great for their health
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food! Ever since they started eating this food they haven't gotten sick or anything. They love the venison formula. Definitely would recommend to anyone who really cares about the health and general well-being of their cats.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Did not work out for me
customer_reviews.text: Thought I would change up my cat's tastes with some different food. My cat pretty much started puking within the first day or two, also my girlfriend's dog started trying to eat the food out of my cat's bowl which she has never done before... Ended up giving it away at work. Could be just my cat, so 2 stars, cool picture on the bag too.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Nicholson

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, quality cat food
customer_reviews.text: Great cat food. My cats love it and it is affordable. It is so hard to find a quality, healthy, tasty, and affordable cat food these days. This fits the bill. My 11 year old cat has had it rough but since I put her on this food 3 months ago, she's not puking much at all now and her poos are beginning to look like turds. A relief for both her and me. Her coat is shiny and she is filling out again. I supplement with 1 can of wet food during the day, separated into several portions. Would love to see this with a subscribe and save option.
customer_reviews.author: Lovely Sword

customer_reviews.title: My cats don't even wait for me to open the bag
customer_reviews.text: I have 3 cats, my oldest is almost 10 years old. I searched so long for healthy and appropriately priced cat food and I finally found it with this product! I want to share that I cannot leave the bag on the floor because my cats will actually use their claws and dig into it. They have NEVER done that to any cat food before. Amazing product!!
customer_reviews.author: S Smith

customer_reviews.title: My bratty cat loves this stuff
customer_reviews.text: My cat is sort of a diva and very particular about what she eats, and she loves crunching away at this stuff. She gets grumpy if there’s none of it left in her bowl, even if she has wet food. Idk how I raised such a brat but if it’s good enough for her it’s good enough for me.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cat Loves It; Just Don't Rush It
customer_reviews.text: As with ANY diet change, make sure that you slowly introduce this food to your cat. If you just replace their old food entirely, of course they're not going to touch this. It took me a week to fully replace my cat's food (Purina Indoor) with this a little at a time, but she's now on 100% of this and doing fine. No vomiting, poo issues or behavioral problems. Keeping this on the food list!
customer_reviews.author: Candace

customer_reviews.title: Only cat food I'll buy
customer_reviews.text: It's good for my cat and keeps him healthy - both in weight and internally. I leave a self-filling feeder out for him and he doesn't overeat and I only have to fill it once a week or so. I have had him 3 years nearly now and I believe I've only gone through 4 or 5 bags - maybe even 3.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Frechette

customer_reviews.title: Cat has vomit issues
customer_reviews.text: so my cat, Melon (yes his name is Melon), had some issues with vomiting after he would eat. i tried everything from limiting his food intake to putting the golf ball in his dish so he doesn't scarf it down but nothing worked. it was suggested that i try this food which doesn't have all of the fillers and grains that cats really aren't supposed to have. he loves this stuff and he has all but stopped the vomiting. Safe to say we are both happy with the switch. he has been eating this for over 6 months now.
customer_reviews.author: Lmiller

customer_reviews.title: Our kitties love it!
customer_reviews.text: When Innova-Evo got recalled a few years ago, I got really worried we wouldn't find a replacement our cats would love as much. Fortunately, our local boutique pet store offers sample-sizes of all their grain-free cat foods. We did a test where we measured the dinner portion by a kitchen scale, then weighed what was left in the morning for a week for each kind of food. This won by a landslide! The newest cat addition to our house even prefers this dry food to ANY canned food. We haven't even bothered going back to the Evo because this is just as loved, just as healthy, and much less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I slowly took my cat's off of Perfect weight Science Diet by adding this two weeks before ...
customer_reviews.text: I slowly took my cat's off of Perfect weight Science Diet by adding this two weeks before giving full strength. One cat can't tolerate it, his bowls are to loose. Their fur has changed, not smooth. They don't like it, they eat because they don't have a choice. Now I'm stuck with a half bag of so called cat food that they don't want.
customer_reviews.author: David Barker

customer_reviews.title: No vomiting from my finicky kitty.  Fat Cat is now called Mittens.
customer_reviews.text: Buy this for my cats and they love it. They were overweight when I started using it and have gotten down to healthy weight even though they have free access. They have shiny coats and lots of energy. Costly but they don't eat as much so it evens out. Have been buying for about a year.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: MAGGOTS
customer_reviews.text: omg. literally. mine came with maggots in it. My trash can: fine. My other cat food: not touched. This bag was flooded with maggots. I literally had to chuck it out in a trash bag. Terrible because i don't know if the food itself is good. But GROSS DIE.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Miller

customer_reviews.title: Sadly my cats do not prefer this food
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 very different cats and sadly, neither one will eat the Taste of the Wild dry food. When I put in their bowl they look at me like they are still waiting to be fed and cry until I give them something - anything - else. I'm not typically a conspiracy theorist, but the food pellets look suspiciously like another dry food I ordered online that they wouldn't eat, which I earlier picked up at the local store and the morsels had an entirely different shape than the ones I received.
customer_reviews.author: Pittsburgh Jill

customer_reviews.title: Cats love it
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 cats, a hefty male and a slight still kittenish female. It was really hard finding quality food that worked for both cats. Taste of the wild was recommended by the humane shelter where we picked up our cats because it's high quality food that works across ages and needs. Both my cats love it and have glossier coats. The kitten is gaining muscle while the older male doesn't overeat and looks leaner. I realized that because the cats feel fuller on the protein they eat less. I used to buy the cheapest food and I'd say while Taste of the Wild is pricier, because my cats eat less, the overall cat food bill is nearly the same.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Williamson

customer_reviews.title: Energy boost, but litterbox still smells
customer_reviews.text: We recently started feeding our cats grain free food. We had hoped that it would make the litterbox not so stinky. I don't think that it has helped in that regard. However, their coats are really soft and shiny. They also have a lot of energy (which can be a bad thing at times if they fight!). Having looked at nearly all the options on Amazon, this food seems to be a great value in terms of grain free foods. We will probably try a few more options to see if it helps with the litterbox smell. The cats seem to like this food though.
customer_reviews.author: TEX1N

customer_reviews.title: 3 out of 3 cats agree, this is the best food out there
customer_reviews.text: My cats love this food. Once I tried switching them (temporarily, out of necessity) to something else (Science Diet) and they looked at me like I was crazy. Yes, I'm a crazy cat lady and talk to my cats. They reluctantly ate the new food, but weren't happy about it. When I switched them back, they started tearing around the house, full of new energy and happiness. I'll never let them run out of this, again. :)
customer_reviews.author: Bliss

customer_reviews.title: Great for picky cats
customer_reviews.text: This is the only food my picky cat will eat. He has tried blue buffalo, blue buffalo wilderness, orijin, and evo and I've always come back to this. I love that it has incredible ingredients and tons of protein but is still very affordable. It also makes his fur incredibly silky, shiny, and soft. This is the only dry food I'll buy. When my parent's cat switched to this food he stopped throwing up almost evert day.
customer_reviews.author: Mackenzie

customer_reviews.title: Healthy and worth the extra cost over grocery store unhealthy brands
customer_reviews.text: I love the Taste of the Wild brand and was feeding only it to my pets but since both cat flavours have fish in it and my Vet wants me to exclude that since it may be her allergen I had to switch. Please spend the few extra dollars a year to get your cat great healthy food like Taste of the Wild, not something you can buy at the grocery store that will probably lead your cat to have hundreds of dollars of vet bills from health problems like mine had from not feeding it a good food. (I fed mostly Meow Mix before this)
customer_reviews.author: Miller

customer_reviews.title: Will continue to buy from here
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I used to go to the local co-op to buy my cat food. It was a hassle because its far away and the bag is heavy. Buying it through amazon was better for me because I didn't have to go out of my way to get the dog food and I didn't need to carry it home. Same price, less effort. I'll definitely be buying my food through amazon more often. As for this brand, I love it. It's healthy and my cat will eat it.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla C

customer_reviews.title: and this is by far her favorite, she has been eating it exclusively for 2 ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried a lot of food with my cat, and this is by far her favorite, she has been eating it exclusively for 2 years, with occasional wet food supplement. She isn't very big so the bag seems to last forever, but the food has no problem staying fresh. Her coat is shiny, her weight is good, and she has a ton of energy. She will go up to the food container and meow that she wants more. I'm happy that she enjoys a food brand that is grain free and affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Meghan

customer_reviews.title: super product
customer_reviews.text: Glad my kit is getting good nutrition without extra filler. It is helping control her weight too.
customer_reviews.author: Joan

customer_reviews.title: Need larger size for cats that swallow food whole..
customer_reviews.text: I heard they made a larger size for cats as my cat Lola keep swalling the small piece whole and then throwing them up in about 5 min.. Hope this is true. will be looking for it on Amazon prime..
customer_reviews.author: NC COUPLE clayton

customer_reviews.title: Good Dry Food
customer_reviews.text: I've given my cat this for a while now and she seems to enjoy it. Her previous dry food was MeowMix but I wanted to try something different and healthier because I noticed she was gaining weight. She's been eating Taste of the Wild for a while now and she doesn't seem to chow it down as fast as her previous dry food (which is a good thing because that's what I want!). She'll eat enough, however, and she's stopped her weight gain. What I've noticed the most with my cat after feeding her this is that her fur is very soft and she doesn't shed as often as she used to. A plus for me!
customer_reviews.author: Mia Kovar

customer_reviews.title: Try this cat food once and your pets and keep on buying it. Good stuff.
customer_reviews.text: We feed this to our cats. One of them was 25 lbs. He has dropped a few pounds since we started this food. The food is a little bit healthier for our cats. This was a personal choice. This food is worth a try at least once. Cats are picky. Your cat may not like it. We chose this food every time. Again, this was a personal. In my opinion this food has helped our adult cat.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Barnhart

product_meta.title: Taste of the Wild Grain Free High Protein Real Meat Recipe Rocky Mountain Premium Dry Cat Food
product_meta.description: Size:15lb - DiscontinuedWatch your cat play and you will soon realize that your purring friend still has many of the same behaviors of a wild cat. Years of domestication and excellent care have turned a short-lived potential foe to a long-lived companion. Feed your cat like the true carnivore they are with Taste of the Wild’s Rocky Mountain Feline Formula with Roasted Venison & Smoked Salmon. A grain-free formula with peas and sweet potatoes provides highly digestible energy for your active cat. Made with real roasted venison and smoked salmon, this formula offers a taste sensation like no other. For today’s healthy cat, this formula is supplemented with vegetables and fruits, providing antioxidants to support a healthy immune system and overall good health. Your cat craves a taste of the wild. Go ahead and give them one.
feature_bullets: A taste of the wild with ROASTED VENISON and SMOKED SALMON; optimal amino acid profile, HIGH QUALITY PROTEIN rich for LEAN, STRONG MUSCLES
High protein ingredients with added vitamins & minerals; fruits and vegetables as SUPERFOODS for hard-working ANTIOXIDANTS; fatty acid blend for SKIN & COAT
Ingredients From Trusted, Sustainable Sources Around The World; Made With No Grain, Corn, Wheat, Filler; No Artificial Flavors, Colors, Preservatives Added
Nutrient rich and HIGHLY DIGESTIBLE with PROPRIETARY PROBIOTICS that survive and thrive in the GI tract; at guaranteed levels
MADE in the USA; FAMILY OWNED & run; food made with scientifically advanced food safety protocols; We'd appreciate your CALL 800.342.4808
